intro: Cnestidium lasiocarpum, commonly known as the woolly fruit-bearing plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, woody fruits and is native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually ovate with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
